org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware

Class HardwareBobAlexanderIII

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware.Robot
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware.HardwareBobAlexanderIII

  • public class HardwareBobAlexanderIII
extends Robot
    The class for the LCR 2018-19 robot. If more components are added, please add them to this class!
    Author:
    Noah Simon

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap)
        Description copied from class: Robot
        Before using the robot, always call this function with the argument hardwareMap. (It's already defined by a superclass.) This function configures the robot to assign specific hardware elements to fields of this class.
        Specified by:
        init in class Robot
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - The hardware map defined by a superclass containing all of the hardware elements.

      • register

        private com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor register(java.lang.String name,
                                                         com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple.Direction direction,
                                                         com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.RunMode runMode)
        A convenience function to configure a DcMotor in order to use it in an OpMode.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the motor configured on the Android devices.
        direction - The motor direction that should be set as positive.
        runMode - How the motor should interpret commands from the OpMode.
        Returns:
        The motor created.

      • drive

        public void drive(double speed,
                  double dist,
                  double timeout)
        Use the drive motors to move the robot in a straight line.
        Specified by:
        drive in class Robot
        Parameters:
        speed - A value from -1 to 1, a higher absolute value meaning a higher speed.
        dist - In inches, the distance the robot should travel.
        timeout - In seconds, how long the robot should attempt to reach the target distance.
        See Also:
        EncoderAuto.encoderDrive(double, double, double, double)

      • drive

        public void drive(double dist,
                  double timeout)
        Drives the robot forward using the default speed.
        Parameters:
        dist - In inches, the distance the robot should travel.
        timeout - In seconds, how long the robot should attempt to reach the target distance.
        See Also:
        drive(double, double, double), EncoderAuto.encoderDrive(double, double, double, double)

      • drive

        public void drive(boolean direction,
                  double dist,
                  double timeout)
        Drives the robot using the default speed in the specified direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - True if forward, false if backward.
        dist - In inches, the distance the robot should travel.
        timeout - In seconds, how long the robot should attempt to reach the target distance.
        See Also:
        drive(double, double, double), EncoderAuto.encoderDrive(double, double, double, double)

      • turn

        public void turn(double speed,
                 double angle,
                 double timeout)
        Use the drive motors to turn the robot in place.
        Specified by:
        turn in class Robot
        Parameters:
        speed - A value from -1 to 1, a higher absolute value meaning a higher speed.
        angle - In degrees, how far the robot should turn. A positive amount is counterclockwise.
        timeout - In seconds, how long the robot should attempt to reach the target angle.
        See Also:
        EncoderAuto.encoderTurn(double, double, double)

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle,
                 double timeout)
        Parameters:
        angle - In degrees, how far the robot should turn. A positive amount is counterclockwise.
        timeout - In seconds, how long the robot should attempt to reach the target angle.
        See Also:
        turn(double, double, double), EncoderAuto.encoderTurn(double, double, double)

      • turn

        public void turn(boolean direction,
                 double angle,
                 double timeout)
        Parameters:
        direction - True if counterclockwise, false if clockwise.
        angle - In degrees, how far the robot should turn.
        timeout - In seconds, how long the robot should attempt to reach the target angle.
        See Also:
        turn(double, double, double), EncoderAuto.encoderTurn(double, double, double)

      • checkSlowMode

        public void checkSlowMode()
        Checks the gamepads to see if A, B, Y, or X have been pressed, If so, it changes the slow mode type accordingly.
